meanings.definition: Awkward or clumsy in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: The boy felt gawkier than usual while trying to dance.
meanings.sent2: She always felt a bit gawkier than her graceful sister.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he couldn't help but appear gawkier than a newborn foal.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as gawkier as a puppet with tangled strings.
meanings.sent5: The gawkier he acted, the more the audience laughed.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of social grace or awareness.
meanings.sent1: He had a gawkier way of speaking that made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She always managed to say the gawkier things at the worst times.
meanings.sent3: His gawkier comments often led to awkward silences in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her words stumbled out gawkier than a toddler learning to talk.
meanings.sent5: The gawkier he behaved, the more isolated he felt.

meanings.definition: More awkward or ungainly than others.
meanings.sent1: Among the group, he was the gawkier one when it came to sports.
meanings.sent2: She felt even gawkier than usual in her oversized costume.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to be graceful only made him seem gawkier than before.
meanings.sent4: The gawkier he moved, the more he tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent5: In a room full of dancers, he stood out as the gawkier one.
